data.title: 1,000 Days of resilience: Ukraine’s struggle amid Russian invasion
data.description: On November 19, the world marks 1,000 days since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

data.title: Govt to tackle THB1.31 trillion NPLs of households, SMEs
data.description: Interest payments for those NPLs that qualify for the campaign will be suspended for 3 years, Finance Ministry announces

data.title: Unicef Myanmar appeals for $208 million to aid conflict-affected children
data.description: Unicef  Myanmar has launched an urgent appeal for US$208 million to support children affected by the escalating conflict in Myanmar.

data.title: Why are Yale students taking K-pop classes?
data.description: At Yale University, K-pop transcends global music fame to become a serious academic subject. At the recent two-day K-Pop: Musical Production and Consumption conference, 160 participants delved into the genre’s history, industry dynamics, and cultural influence.

data.title: Only three official entry points at Kelantan-Thailand border, says Saifuddin
data.description: There are only three official entry points along the Malaysia-Thailand border in Kelantan—the Immigration, Customs, Quarantine and Security (ICQS) Complexes in Rantau Panjang, Bukit Bunga and Pengkalan Kubor, says Home Minister Saifuddin Nasution Ismail.

data.title: UNICEF Myanmar appeals for $208 million to aid conflict-affected children
data.description: UNICEF Myanmar has launched an urgent appeal for US$208 million to support children affected by the escalating conflict in Myanmar.

data.title: Why are Yale students taking K-pop classes?
data.description: NEW HAVEN, Connecticut — At Yale University, K-pop is not just a global music phenomenon -- it is the subject of serious academic inquiry. During the recent two-day K-Pop: Musical Production and Consumption conference on Thursday and Friday, 160 participants gathered to explore the genre’s history, industry dynamics and cultural impact.

data.title: Only three official entry points at Kelantan-Thailand border, says Saifuddin
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR: There are only three official entry points along the Malaysia-Thailand border in Kelantan—the Immigration, Customs, Quarantine and Security (ICQS) Complexes in Rantau Panjang, Bukit Bunga and Pengkalan Kubor, says Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail (pic).

data.title: Middle path sought in referendum majority row
data.description: A United Thai Nation list-MP has expressed support for a middle path as MPs and Senators continue to thrash out their differences over the size of the majority required to pass a  referendum  on amending the  constitution .

data.title: Thailand to increase emission reduction targets
data.description: Thailand will aim to further reduce its  emissions  of harmful gases because a follow-up on the 2015 Paris climate agreement shows the country’s efforts are falling short of its target to help control the rising temperature of the planet, according to Chalermchai Sri-on, the minister of Natural Resources and Environment.

data.title: City Hall ‘sorry’ for cycle lane chaos
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) has issued an apology and reopened a lane to traffic in Sukhumvit Soi 39 a day after closing it for a  bicycle lane .

data.title: Old national stadium eyed as concert venue
data.description: The Ministry of Tourism and Sports plans to turn the  Supachalasai National Stadium  on Rama I Road into a new concert venue.

data.title: Murder, money, betrayal: Unravelling ‘Am Cyanide’s’ web of deaths
data.description: The Nation looks at how Sararat Rangsiwuthaporn made calculated moves to disguise her murders as natural deaths, culminating in her death sentence

data.title: Jury still out on Thaksin’s ‘dual citizenship’
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa on Wednesday downplayed reports that former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra ’s role as a “campaign assistant” for the Pheu Thai Party may be illegal as he holds dual citizenship.

data.title: Infrastructure developer WHA Corporation holds first open house
data.description: WHA Corporation, Thailand’s largest infrastructure developer, hosted its first open house event on Wednesday, highlighting its vision to become a tech and sustainable company.

data.title: Thailand detects first case of new vaping disease
data.description: Thai health authorities have reported the first local case of a new  vaping -related disease, and they fear more cases linked to heavy use of  e-cigarettes .

data.title: With a score of 20, Thailand ranks low in global ‘parenthood’ ratings
data.description: Population Development Plan focuses on ‘family-friendly policies’

data.title: What’s the legal path for exiled ex-PM Yingluck to return home?
data.description: Thaksin does not see any obstacles to his sister returning to Thailand before Songkran next year

data.title: PTT shows strong performance, vows to pursue low-carbon trends
data.description: PTT Plc has witnessed strong performance in the first nine months of this year, vowing to penetrate low-carbon business to meet global energy trends.

data.title: Thailand plans major revamp of venues to host global events
data.description: Tourism and Sports Ministry plans to revitalise the event infrastructure, including redeveloping the National Stadium into a multi-function venue

data.title: Rice farmers to get help with harvest costs
data.description: The government is preparing to scrap a much-criticised  fertiliser  co-payment scheme and replace it with a new programme aimed at reducing  rice farmers ’ harvest costs, according to Agriculture Minister Narumon Pinyosinwat.

data.title: AAI Reports 283% Profit Growth, Eyes Continued Expansion
data.description: Asian Alliance International Public Company Limited (AAI), a leading Thai pet food manufacturer, reported outstanding Q3/2024 performance, with revenue growth of 37.8% and a net profit increase of 145% compared to the same period last year. This was driven by increased demand in pet food business, which remains the primary growth driver. For the first nine months of this year, net profit surged by 283.4% compared to the same period last year, reflecting strong demand from major brand clients who launched new products tailored to owners seeking specialised pet food. The gross profit margin remains within the target of 20-21%. The company is confident that total revenue for this year will meet the target of THB 6,500 million, comprising THB 5,700 million from pet food business and THB 800 million from human shelf-stable food. Production capacity expansion plans are progressing as expected. In August, the company commenced dry pet food production under the “Pro” brand and expanded capacity for canned and pouch-packed products, which will increase wet pet food production to 59,000 tons per year by Q1 next year.

data.title: Voices of Change: CP Group's Young Leaders on the Global Stage 🌍✨
data.description: Get ready to meet four of CP Group’s delegates who proudly represented Thailand at the One Young World Summit 2024 in Montreal!

data.title: Putin ‘open to Ukraine truce talks with Trump’
data.description: MOSCOW — Russian President Vladimir Putin is open to discussing a Ukraine ceasefire deal with Donald Trump but rules out making any major territorial concessions and insists Kyiv abandon ambitions to join NATO, five sources with knowledge of Kremlin thinking told Reuters.
